A Portrait of Regret

A dim room, a dusty book, a portrait.  
He gazes, lost in memory.  
“I confided everything to her.”  

---

Outside, Dounia struggles with emotions.  
“Everything will be different now.”  
“Am I ready for this?”  

---

He walks away, burdened by thoughts.  
“Why do I consent to this life?”  
“Why am I so contemptible?”  

---

Dounia glances back, love and pain.  
“Will we ever be free of this?”  
He gestures her away, heart heavy.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The protagonist reflects on his past and the inevitability of suffering, questioning the purpose of his impending hardships.
